WMAP5.name: WMAP5
WMAP5.reference: Komatsu et al. 2009, ApJS, 180, 330, doi: 10.1088/0067-0049/180/2/330. Table 1 (WMAP + BAO + SN ML).

WMAP7.name: WMAP7
WMAP7.reference: Komatsu et al. 2011, ApJS, 192, 18, doi: 10.1088/0067-0049/192/2/18. Table 1 (WMAP + BAO + H0 ML).

WMAP9.name: WMAP9
WMAP9.reference: Hinshaw et al. 2013, ApJS, 208, 19, doi: 10.1088/0067-0049/208/2/19. Table 4 (WMAP9 + eCMB + BAO + H0, last column)

Planck13.name: Planck13
Planck13.reference: Planck Collaboration 2014, A&A, 571, A16 (Paper XVI), Table 5 (Planck + WP + highL + BAO)
Planck13.info: Planck 2013 paper XVI Table 5 penultimate column (best fit)

Planck15.name: Planck15
Planck15.reference: Planck Collaboration 2016, A&A, 594, A13 (Paper XIII), Table 4 (TT, TE, EE + lowP + lensing + ext)
Planck15.info: Planck 2015 paper XII Table 4 final column (best fit)

Planck18.name: Planck18
Planck18.reference: Planck Collaboration 2018, 2020, A&A, 641, A6  (Paper VI), Table 2 (TT, TE, EE + lowE + lensing + BAO)
Planck18.info: Unlike Planck 2015, the paper includes massive neutrinos in Om0, which here are included in m_nu. Hence, the Om0 value differs slightly from the paper.

Planck18_arXiv_v2.name: Planck18
Planck18_arXiv_v2.reference: DEPRECATED: Planck Collaboration 2018, 2020, A&A, 641, A6  (Paper VI), Table 2 (TT, TE, EE + lowE + lensing + BAO)
Planck18_arXiv_v2.info: Unlike Planck 2015, the paper includes massive neutrinos in Om0, which here are included in m_nu. Hence, the Om0 value differs slightly from the paper.
